title: Ticket #2169: Clearly document that node priorities do not apply across sub-DAGs
description: Make it clear that sub-DAGs are completely separate as far as node priorities are concerned, and that the priorities don't propagate down to the sub-DAGs. Probably should give an example like Logan's situation, where he thought that a better priority for one sub-DAG would mean that all of its jobs would get priority over jobs from another sub-DAG that had lower priority in the upper-level DAG. (From today's meeting with Spalding lab people.)
remarks:
2011-Jul-12 12:46:23 by smoler:
Reasonably simple, partial DAG input file example to help illustrate: 

    SUBDAG EXTERNAL A  A.dag
    SUBDAG EXTERNAL B  B.dag
    PRIORITY A  100
    PRIORITY B  0

Once any node jobs of A and B are submitted, then this priority setting is completely irrelevant. Yes, the first 5 (default) jobs of A are going to be submitted first, but other than that, setting the PRIORITY of subdag A and/or subdag B has no effect. This priority is not transmitted in any way to the separate subdags.
